name: North West Clumber Walk: A Tale of Two Bridges, Clumber Park

ai.summary: A challenging 19.2 km circuit around Clumber Park, titled North West Clumber Walk: A Tale of Two Bridges. This hard ridge-themed hike threads between parkland and woodlands, linking two iconic bridges while offering persistent elevation gain, varied footing, and rewarding views for experienced walkers.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of surfaced park paths, damp woodland trails, grassy ridges and occasional boardwalks by water. Footing can be uneven with roots, mud after rain, and some steeper, rocky sections. The distance demands stamina and navigation attention across long stretches with exposure to wind along open ridges.
ai.safety_notes: This is a hard 19.2 km hike. Wear sturdy, grip-friendly footwear and bring sufficient water and snacks. Check weather and daylight hours, as UK conditions can be muddy and damp. Carry a map or GPS, stay on marked paths, and be cautious near water and along the two bridges. Inform someone of your planned route, carry a basic first aid kit, and consider starting early in lighter seasons.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Weather-appropriate layers and a rain shell
Map or offline navigation (GPS) and a compass
Small first aid kit and blister care
Walking poles (optional but helpful on ridges)
ai.best_seasons: Spring, Summer, and Autumn. Winter hikes can be cold, muddy, and have shorter daylight hours.
